ch.iserver.ace.collaboration
Interface CollaborationService

All Known Implementing Classes:
CollaborationServiceImpl
public interface CollaborationService

The CollaborationService is the entry point for all collaboration operations. There are methods related to registering listeners for incoming events such as discoveries and invitations, and there are methods for publishing local documents.

The CollaborationService has to be started before any events are published by it. If the CollaborationService is no longer used, it should be stopped.

Discovery Listeners

First, you have to register the listener and start the service. 
  CollaborationService service = ...;
  service.addDocumentListener(myDocumentListener);
  service.addUserListener(myUserListener);
  service.start();
Then, you will get discovery events on those two listeners you have registered.

Callbacks

The CollaborationService supports two different callback objects. An InvitationCallback can be set with the setInvitationCallback(InvitationCallback) method. Incoming invitations are passed to that callback. The other callback is notified about service failures. It can be set with the setFailureHandler(ServiceFailureHandler) method.

Publishing Documents

A local document can be published with the publish(PublishedSessionCallback, DocumentModel) method. Published documents can then be joined by other users.

Method Summary
 void addDocumentListener(DocumentListener l)
          Adds a document listener to the list of registered listeners.
 void addUserListener(UserListener l)
          Adds a user discovery listener to the list of registered listeners.

          Initiates an explicit discovery of a user.
 ServerInfo getServerInfo()
          Retrieves the ServerInfo of the local server.

          Publishes a document so that other users can join editing it over the network.

          Removes a document discovery listener from the list of registered listeners.

 void stop()

Method Detail

getServerInfo

ServerInfo getServerInfo()
Retrieves the ServerInfo of the local server. This information is mainly useful as feedback to the local user. If may not be available right after starting. If getting the information fails, the client should periodically poll the CollaborationService for the ServerInfo object.

Returns:
the server info object

start

void start()
Starts the CollaborationService. No events are fired before this method is called.

stop

void stop()
Stops the CollaborationService. This method destroys the collaboration service. Do not call any methods after this method call.

setUserId

void setUserId(String id)
Sets the user id of the local user. This method has to be called before starting the service with the start() method. Note, it is an error to set the user id twice!

Parameters:
id - the id of the local user

setUserDetails

void setUserDetails(UserDetails details)
Sets the UserDetails for the local user.

Parameters:
details - the new UserDetails

addUserListener

void addUserListener(UserListener l)
Adds a user discovery listener to the list of registered listeners.

Parameters:
l - the listener to add

removeUserListener

void removeUserListener(UserListener l)
Removes a user discovery listener from the list of registered listeners.

Parameters:
l - the listener to remove

addDocumentListener

void addDocumentListener(DocumentListener l)
Adds a document listener to the list of registered listeners.

Parameters:
l - the listener to add

removeDocumentListener

void removeDocumentListener(DocumentListener l)
Removes a document discovery listener from the list of registered listeners.

Parameters:
l - the listener to remove

setInvitationCallback

void setInvitationCallback(InvitationCallback processor)
Sets the InvitationCallback for the service. The InvitationCallback is responsible to handle all invitations sent to this user.

Parameters:
processor - the InvitationCallback used by the service

setFailureHandler

void setFailureHandler(ServiceFailureHandler handler)
Sets the ServiceFailureHandler for the service. This handler gets notified about failures in the collaboration and network layers.

Parameters:
handler - the new failure handler

publish

PublishedSession publish(PublishedSessionCallback callback,
                         DocumentModel document)
Publishes a document so that other users can join editing it over the network.

Parameters:
callback - the SessionCallback used for callbacks
document - the document to publish
Returns:
a session for the publisher itself

discoverUser

void discoverUser(DiscoveryCallback callback,
                  InetAddress addr,
                  int port)
Initiates an explicit discovery of a user. The network layer tries to contact the given host on the given port. The result is communicated to the DiscoveryCallback objects.

Parameters:
callback - the DiscoveryCallback to be notified
addr - the target address
port - the target port
